--- title: "About the workshop" execute: echo: false warning: false error: false --- :spiral_calendar: September 26-28, 2022\ :clock9: 09:00 - 17:00\ :city_sunrise: Dar-es-Salaam, Tanzania ------------------------------------------------------------------------ This workshop targets public health researchers and aims to accompany them in their journey towards Data Science. ## Is this workshop for me? This workshop is relevant for researchers who answer *yes* at least to one of the following questions: - [ ] Do you who want to develop data science projects in public health? - [ ] Do you wants to learn more about how open and reproducible science approaches can be used in your daily practice? - [ ] Are you a Stata user (or any other data analysis language) who would like to expand your data analysis skillset with R? - [ ] Do you want to bridge analyses between data analysis tools (Stata, R or Python) and to more easily collaborate on data analysis with other researchers? ## Learning objectives There are two complementary aspects of moving into data science: 1. a **mindset** about how scientists think and collaborate about data, and 2. a **skillset** which is composed of an ecosystem of tools (mostly open-source) and practices. Upon completing the workshop, participants will have gained: - exposure to data science approach, tools and collaborative practices - learned the basics of working with dynamic documents in RStudio, and how to incrementally incorporate R into your existing data analysis workflows - hands-on experience on how to interface between Stata and R and combine them depending on your skills and needs. The idea is not to replace everything you are already doing in Stata into R but that you can continue your learning journey after this workshop at your own pace, also using some of the resources listed in @sec-useful-resources. ## To do before the workshop 1. Fill out the online [pre-workshop questionnaire](https://timicodktest.smartforest.de/-/single/cac06e76b3e163e655e49626f8129de8f55a8035ced54f15bc4c6cf527dba8a7?st=DnBRz677PIYh33ML0rE1amWzyhCIYPGFQnmZ6AAou8nJFyikWN6nLM5i3G4I0YZN) 2. If you have not it yet, please go through the following five steps (about 30 minutes). a. Install R (@sec-R-installation) b. Install and setup RStudio Desktop (@sec-RStudio-installation) c. Install Quarto (@sec-Quarto-installation) d. Install the rmarkdown R package (@sec-rmarkdown-installation) e. Create a GitHub account (@sec-GitHub-account-creation) f. Install GitHub Desktop (@sec-GitHub-Desktop-installation) ::: callout-note - All software used in this workshop are free. - If you have any difficulties with the installation, support can be provided on the first day of the workshop before the first session or during breaks. ::: ::: callout-important For those who have already been introduced to Git, R/RStudio and RMarkdown, note that you need to additionally install Quarto for this workshop. ::: ## Venue The workshop takes place at **Protea Hotel Dar es Salaam Courtyard** on Seaview Ocean Road. The conference room is **Nelson Hall**. ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
